column4: Do I need to install something to get my webcam running (I'm on Ubuntu 11.10) ?
try cheese first
Is cheese installed by default with Ubuntu 11.10?
if it works in cheese you are golden
not sure but its easily installed

I don't get it, when I was installing Ubuntu. I got the option to take a picture and set it as my identity. If Ubuntu can detect my webcam (and use it) why do I need to install software? So there must be something already installed. Anyone knows?
its a simple test. It can be equally easily uninstalled. It may be in a default install too. Instead of typing here, why are you not exploring my suggestion?
Alright, sorry :) I should go and check it out.
does what you use require sun java?
How do I know if it requires sun java?
I'm running the TopCoder.com applet
it may state on the developer site, or you can ask them
I did this i.e. ran it through the command line and it opened up (with OpenJDK) so I don't think it is because it requires Sun Java. Can you seem to be able to spot any issues now?
http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/debian-26/java-doesnt-work-in-my-browser-910860/
does the last command work ok for you?
Yes.
sweet
But when I right click -> open with -> Iced tea web start 6 it, tries to download the .jar file and then gets stuck at 6% and after a while reports the error I pasted earlier.
you could make a bash script, or alias to run that command easier
or make a copy of the launcher for Iced tea in /usr/share/applications     and change the Exec= line to run that
right click it maybe...
